page.title: 07CLEE HILL AREA WATER SUPPLY
page.content: Until 1984 this area has had its water from{The Elan Valley Supply.}In December we changed to water from the{ {Trimpley Works,}which draws water from the R.Severn. The supply was switched because there would be a pollution problem, as the Elan reservoir was open and very old. When people in this area were first told that we were to change our water supply, they started to protest and complain because other areas had had problems. When we first got the water in our taps, people said it was undrinkable and over chlorinated. The water has a different taste and smell, and also caused skin rashes and mouth ulcers.The new water is harder. The level of chlorine has now been reduced. People are beinning to get used to it, and recently there has been few complaints.
